programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: The team jumps into action when analyst Kelly Moran is taken hostage.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: After a mysterious bioweapon leaves two MTA workers dead and one injured, the team rushes to determine who is behind the attack and the location of their next target; Jubal's past demons begin to surface.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a professional informant after he's found dead outside an abandoned factory; Maggie reconnects with an old colleague and mentor.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: After a string of armed robberies targets various businesses, the team investigates a suspect who leads them to something much bigger; OA worries about his future when his investments begin to go south.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: When an off-duty diplomatic security agent is fatally shot in New York City trying to apprehend someone, the team investigates if there's a connection to his time working in Croatia.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: The shooting of a federal corrections officer leads the team to an ex-Marine who has gone rogue ever since he returned from Afghanistan; Tiffany's sister looks to her for guidance when their younger brother begins to lash out.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: A successful stock broker on Wall Street is murdered in cold blood, and Andy the janitor is the first one to find his body. But when the simple man gets blood on his hands and accidentally incriminates himself, he turns to Mike Hammer to help him clear his good name. Hammer sees that Andy is innocent, but his attempt to find the real culprit is nearly foiled by a series of traps and pitfalls that evade the private eye's keen intuitions and continue to make the janitor look guilty.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: While on a stakeout, Mike steps in to save a cop and arrest a mobster. Lingering doubts about the scenario trouble Hammer, and he searches for a connection. A surprise birthday party interrupts his train of thought, but a threatening phone call puts the private investigator right back in the thick of things. When the caller tell Mike Hammer that he has 24 hours to live, he must uncover the truth at the bottom of the mystery.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: Mike Hammer is a big fan and old friend of Buzz MacClaine, a popular mystery writer, and the author asks the private eye to help edit his latest work. When Buzz meets his own violent end, Mike Hammer takes on the case to find the killer. But in this case, life seems to imitate art. Hammer and his team realize that his manuscript is filled with clues to an actual crime, and they must decode the mystery novel in order to find Buzz's killer.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: There's more than just paint on the walls when Mike tries to help Velda after her boyfriend, an artist, is murdered in his studio before an exhibition. But Hammer struggles to connect the dots in this mysterious case, and a long list of suspects emerges when he discovers that the artist often made others see red. Could it be the artist's jealous ex, the wealthy art collector, the corrupted art critic, the gallery owner, or even Velda herself?

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: A drone strike on a bomb-making compound in Afghanistan leads to the discovery of a retired Marine's remains.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The team investigates an intel operation after four people connected to the project die in a diner explosion.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: When a U.S. senatorial candidate's staffer is run over and killed while crossing the street, the team must determine if it was an accident or a murder than could put others in danger.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: A CIA agent who once worked with Sam seeks his help before dying of an apparent suicide; while working under cover, Deeks and Kensi enter a prized poodle in a dog show.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: A CIA agent's death leads the team to a group of dangerous Russian agents; Hanna worries a secret will be exposed.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: A family friend asks Herrmann for some advice on opening a bar; tensions run high between Emma and Violet; Kidd struggles to keep her team together.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Mouch and Ritter work together to solve a murder mystery; Severide and Cruz tackle a food truck fire; Gallo goes to see Hawkins about Violet.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: The big wedding day arrives and Firehouse 51 welcomes Casey back to celebrate the joyous occasion; Emma's plans to replace Violet come to a shocking end.

programme.desc: Kidd and Severide's honeymoon is interrupted by a dangerous person from their past; Kidd's former academy classmate joins Firehouse 51; Brett and Violet reflect on their relationships.

programme.desc: Javi spends a couple of shifts at Firehouse 51; Kidd and Carver work together to help Carver's former boss; as Hawkins and Violet's relationship blossoms, Gallo turns his attention elsewhere.

programme.desc: Kidd recruits Carver, Capp and Tony to help prepare her new lieutenant's quarters; Severide and Detective Pryma reluctantly pair up to work a police investigation; Firehouse 51 comes together to fight a movie theater fire.

programme.desc: Kidd gets a glimpse into Carver's chaotic personal life; Mouch and Herrmann receive an unexpected gift.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Firehouse 51 hosts a Halloween open house; Kidd and Severide help a young girl after she gets kicked out of her home.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Severide and Kidd investigate an explosion at a jewelry store; Cruz and Chloe take steps to make Javi a permanent part of their family; Gallo, Ritter and Mouch try to bond with Carver.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Herrmann is tasked with fulfilling a man's dying wish; Kidd reflects on her Girls on Fire program after one of her students graduates from the Fire Academy; a heckler harasses Firehouse 51.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Detective Pryma asks for Severide's help on a case involving explosives; Gallo and Carver clash after Gallo improvises on a call; Violet encourages Brett to start dating again.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Severide struggles with the cost of helping Det. Pryma with the Martucci case; Gallo campaigns for Herrmann to represent 51 at the National Firefighter's Association's Winter Conference; a familiar face makes a shocking return.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Detective Pryma's case comes to an explosive end with Kidd and Carver's lives in danger; Brett installs an infant safe surrender box at 51; Violet is determined to take Emma down.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Firehouse 51 prepares for their semi-annual firehouse inspection; Brett fights to save her paramedicine program; Commander Martin Pearce asks Severide for a favor.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Truck and squad clash after a tense call rescuing a doomsday prepper; Herrmann struggles with Cindy's diagnosis; Violet gives Brett and Gallo dating advice.

programme.title: Acapulco H.E.A.T.
programme.desc: Cat infiltrates a drug cartel run by former KGB agents to investigate the disappearance of a UN employee who may have joined the ring.

programme.title: Acapulco H.E.A.T.
programme.desc: Brett poses as the son of an industrialist to stop a kidnapping ring.

programme.title: Acapulco H.E.A.T.
programme.desc: Trailing a scientist suspected of developing biological weapons, the team stumbles onto part of his research, a man whose body's being genetically altered.

programme.title: Acapulco H.E.A.T.
programme.desc: Vacationers assist the H.E.A.T. in an effort to find the doctor who's running a black-market baby ring.

programme.desc: After a reshuffling of assignments, Pride returns to the New Orleans office during the investigation of a missing petty officer.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The NCIS team investigates the murder of Patton's friend, a former Navy SEAL gunned down in a drive-by shooting while Patton watched.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A Navy lieutenant from a well-connected and affluent family has a fatal fall down a flight of stairs at a charity gala; the team investigates whether his death was an accident or foul play.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: When Elvis Bertrand's "daughter" is linked to a murder case, he asks Pride to prove her innocence.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Tammy is convinced that a con man committed the hit-and-run murder of a Navy doctor, even though the evidence shows otherwise; unbeknownst to Hannah, her husband approaches Pride with new intel on an underground spy network.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny must track down the drug cartel that attacked a convoy transporting drugs to be incinerated, leaving Baez seriously injured; Frank must tread carefully when a lieutenant's actions cause controversy for the police department.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Jamie stands up for a fellow officer who is being ostracized for testifying against her partner; sports analyst Boomer Esiason makes a difficult request of Frank.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: When an officer is outed and his partner refuses to ride with him, Danny and Baez are asked to work with new partners temporarily; Eddie and James try to steal a collar from a pompous detective; Frank speaks out about equality on the force.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Frank is put in a tough spot when Danny is charged with using excessive force; Jamie brings a homeless man to the hospital and hits it off with an attractive doctor.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Jamie becomes a target after intervening in an abusive relationship between a thug and his girlfriend; an illegal recording of Henry making insensitive comments is leaked to the press.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny and Frank must find enough evidence to finally put away an international felon who has a history of walking away from charges; Erin considers going into private practice; Danny and his new boss butt heads.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Frank is taken by surprise during an on-air interview; Danny and his new boss clash as they investigate a drive-by shooing.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: When an officer's body camera malfunctions during an altercation, Frank is faced with public backlash; Baez and Danny step in when a witness is denied protection by the U.S. Marshals Service; Erin looks into a rape claim made by a friend's daughter.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: When three prominent community leaders are murdered, they seem to be casualties of hate crimes; after being mugged, Linda decides to carry a gun.

programme.title: Elizabeth Smart: Autobiography
programme.desc: Elizabeth Smart tells the story of her kidnapping at 14-years-old, and nine months of captivity and sexual abuse at the hands of a self-styled religious prophet.

programme.title: Elizabeth Smart: Autobiography
programme.desc: The second part of Elizabeth Smart's personal story of abduction, captivity and sexual abuse at the hands of a self-styled religious prophet.

programme.title: Gangsters: America's Most Evil
programme.desc: Anibal Mustelier was considered amongst the most dangerous criminals of the Cocaine Cowboy days in Miami; suspected of multiple assassinations and the mastermind behind elaborate bank and jewelry heists.

programme.title: Gangsters: America's Most Evil
programme.desc: Clarence Heatley and his Preacher Crew; the crew extorted, kidnapped, and even killed to gain notoriety on the streets of the Bronx and Harlem.

programme.title: Gangsters: America's Most Evil
programme.desc: David Thai is the leader of the Born to Kill gang, a group of ruthless young men who terrorize Chinatown in New York City; the gang extorts shop owners who are too fearful to turn to police and start a war with rival gangs.

programme.title: Gangsters: America's Most Evil
programme.desc: Moya and his chief enforcer, Andre Paige, led a deadly narcotics and extortion racket in New York City.

programme.title: Gangsters: America's Most Evil
programme.desc: Alejandro Corredor was Kansas City's cocaine pipeline, moving massive shipments from Mexico's Sinaloa Cartel.

programme.title: Gangsters: America's Most Evil

programme.title: Gangsters: America's Most Evil
programme.desc: Christopher Coke used his criminal wealth and prosperity to win the hearts of his community and influence their political affiliations.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: 10/14/22: Bryce Harper and Rhys Hoskins each homer while Aaron Nola tosses six-plus scoreless frames to lead the Phillies to a 9-1 Game 3 win over the Braves at home.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: The Guardians pull through in the 10th inning with some late theatrics to tie up the ALDS

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: 10/14/22: Trent Grisham hits a solo home run in the bottom of the 4th inning and Blake Snell strikes out six batters, while the Padres' bullpen shuts down the Dodgers' bats to give San Diego a 2-1 series lead over Los Angeles.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Mike Cuellar and the consistent Orioles offense leads towards a World Series victory

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: 10/15/86: The Astros scored three runs in the 1st inning and took the lead deep into the 9th, until the Mets retaliated with three runs to send the game into extras. Fast forward to the top of the 16th when Ray Knights hit a go-ahead knock and the rest is history!

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: 10/15/88: Hobbled by hamstring and knee injuries, Kirk Gibson delivers a dramatic pinch-hit, walk-off home run against A's closer Dennis Eckersley, giving the Dodgers a stunning come-from-behind win in Game 1 of the 1988 World Series.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Carlos Correa's go-ahead home run gives the Astros Game 1 ALCS win

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Phillies' bats erupt in an 8-3 win over the Braves as Philadelphia advances to the NLCS

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: 10/15/22: Jeremy Peña crushes a go-ahead solo home run in the top of the 18th inning and the Astros' pitching staff shutout the Mariners as Houston wins 1-0, advancing to the American League Championship Series.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Oscar Gonzalez's two-run walk-off single gives the Guardians a 2-1 series lead over the Yankees

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: The Padres score five runs in the 7th to defeat the Dodgers in Game 4 and advance to the NLCS

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: George Brett collects four RBIs against the Blue Jays in the Royals' 6-5 win in Game 3 of the ALCS.

programme.desc: Austin Riley hits a walk-off single to lead the Braves to a NLCS Game 1 win

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Gerrit Cole slings seven strong innings in Game 4 of the ALDS in a 4-2 win over the Guardians

programme.desc: Brad Lidge closed out the Rays and a perfect season as Harry Kalas declared "The Philadelphia Phillies are 2008 World Champions of baseball".

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A longtime customer has his eye set on a car from Joe's personal collection, a 1967 Nova; Joe counters by offering up a 1966 Nova, with the guarantee that it will be twice the car Joe's is; big brakes, big power, big wheels and more.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The guys bring a 1964 Lincoln back with a late-model Coyote engine and handmade interior; the Sling-Ray is a custom automotive sensation, but Ekstensive has what it's been missing.

programme.title: Unique Rides
programme.desc: The shop flips a Range Rover makeover for rapper Fat Joe; Will and Team Unique turn a new wide-body Chevrolet Corvette Z06 into an unusual wide-body showpiece.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave convinces the client to make the 1967 C10 truck into a convertible; Kevin takes on a new personal project with a Cadillac Escalade.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The engineering on the convertible C10 works in theory, but making it work in practice is the next step; a team brings in a replica 1967 Cobra with a bad engine.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: The clock is ticking to complete a 1968 Corvette convertible, but messy fiberglass repairs uncover major collision damage; and if that wasn't enough, the customer also wants an all-white interior, which isn't a good fit for such a dirty job.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A local client wants the teams help to surprise his dad with a custom 1946 Ford Coupe; Bill goes for a mix of both classy and supercharged when working on his wife's 2021 Escalade.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys try to shed light on whether iron or aluminum heads will deliver more power; they'll look at weight savings and heat retention's effect on cylinder pressure.

programme.title: Dirt Every Day
programme.desc: It's time for the Dirt-Heads to build a YJ for Dave; they'll have to undo a fair bit in just a few days to turn Butter Jeep into a trail machine, before heading to Oregon's Tillamook Forest.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Kevin Schiele breathes new life into a semi-hauler by giving it a visual and functional upgrade that impeccably reflects his expertise in trucks.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe pulls out all the stops to make the '66 Nova the car of his client's dreams; Joe doesn't just want a mean motor and big tires; he wants a chopped roof, but the car might be too far behind schedule for a chop, even if it does up the cool factor.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Rocker Ted Nugent brings in his beloved '74 Bronco; Bill and the guys make an all-terrain beast unlike any other; With his creative sparks flying, Bill gets going on a build he's dreamed about for years: a handmade, all-tube, off-road buggy.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A client enlists Dave on a mission from God to make his dreams of a father/son road trip along Route 66 come true; getting the client's mechanically unsound reproduction of the Bluesmobile ready for the road will test the crew's mettle.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Bogi and Faye describe a common failure problem on a fifth-generation Camaro. The torque converter can fail in the transmission, causing the car to shake at 40-50 mph. The girls upgrade the factory torque converter to fix this problem for good.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Four gears are better than two, so the crew takes the old two-speed Powerglide out of a '67 Chevy Camaro and installs a Muncie four speed.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: The guys bring in a vintage 1979 Jeep that is being sent to auction to give it a finished interior with carpet and panels; Jeremy uses a sewing machine to bind the carpet edges.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Fuller and Jeremy take a first-generation Scout apart and put an all-new chassis, drive train and 4-link suspension underneath.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: After a nationwide search to find the best metal fabrication prospects around, Dave Kindig and KevDogg have invited 12 people to the shop to compete for one job at Kindig-It Design.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: The remaining competitors pair up for a challenge to create a signature Kindig-It build feature; teamwork is critical, and the team that can't figure it out will pack their bags.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: Dave and Kev divide the group into two teams, and explain the day's assignment; the teams must navigate a tricky exhaust challenge; the losing team will have to make a difficult choice.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: Project managers are chosen; designing and executing a wing on a '68 Camaro trunk lid.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Most convertible tops from the late 60's, early 70's have problems; the AGG crew will demonstrate how to replace and rebuild a convertible top from top to bottom.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Deciding whether fix a problem engine or throw in a new one; a 355 Crate engine for a '33 Ford Roadster.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Jared and Lou prove a diesel sedan delivers massive power; Lou fabricates an intercooler and a larger turbo on a vintage Mercedes 300D, while Jared takes a BMW 335D and adds an ECU upgrade with turbos.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Reviewing 50 years of the iconic Chevrolet Camaro, from the prototype Camaro No. 1 to the 2017 COPO Camaro.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: The Jeepster project is back, and Ian wants to focus on some of the drivetrain components; he pulls out a 3.5-liter Ecoboost engine and a 6-R-80 transmission from a Ford Expedition to help the old Jeep drive like a more modern one.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian takes a rusted-out 1960 Chevy Apache and takes off his favorite body panels to install over a 2005 long-bed Chevy.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Bogi and Faye show how a worn-out Toyota's steering rack and pinion works, where they fail, and how to rebuild it with a simple rebuild kit.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The new-generation, mid-engine Corvette is here, and the girls take one for a test drive; the C8 is already cool, but they make it better with aftermarket exhaust and some other goodies.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Fuller and Bumpus bring in a 1959 Ford Edsel and take out the stock transmission to put in an automatic overdrive and give the classic car extra shifting power.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: The guys bring in a very clean '69 fastback Mustang; the owner has added extra power under the hood, Bryan and Jeremy need to upgrade the rear end with a Posi unit; they also upgrade the transmission to give the owner a few extra gears.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian doesn't like spending money on new trucks, so he just builds what he wants; today, he starts working on a custom frame to sit under a classic Jeepster Commando and outfits the suspension, along with getting new one-ton axles underneath.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian brings in a 1968 M715 to make it more reliable; he takes the body off the original chassis and stretches a Jeep JK chassis to make it fit; he adds upgraded suspension, 1-ton axles and an LS engine to make it a truck that can fight any battle.

programme.title: American Girl
programme.desc: A young woman with political and social-justice aspirations finds herself trying to survive on the streets of Atlanta after running away from home.

programme.title: Induced 2
programme.desc: A couple hires a new midwife, only to be stalked by a crazed woman who will stop at nothing in her attempt to steal their new baby.

programme.title: 10 Reasons Why Men Cheat
programme.desc: In the wake of a wedding catastrophe, three couples discover the meaning of commitment while discussing what women want to know most of all when it comes to men and relationships.

programme.title: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: Four women struggle to cope with their sexual preferences: having sex with other women. Will they risk being themselves, even if it costs their lives?

programme.title: Behind Closed Doors 2: Toxic Workplace
programme.desc: Newly hired employee Joy carries high hopes for success at her new marketing job, but her boss's intentions are anything but professional.

programme.title: Below the Belt
programme.desc: Endometriosis affects one in nine women, but patients are often dismissed, discounted and disbelieved. There is no known cure for this disease, and it often takes years to be diagnosed.

programme.title: Battered Emotions
programme.desc: Grappling with a breast cancer diagnosis, Rasheada fights to stay strong while her sister and best friend face their own personal battles.

programme.title: Battered Emotions 2
programme.desc: A pregnant woman makes the decision to leave her abusive boyfriend after an act of violence proves to be the last straw for their relationship.

programme.title: Art of Love
programme.desc: After a government contracted hit goes wrong, the collateral damage causes Lucas Alba to retire. He may be done, but his past eventually catches up with him, putting his life in jeopardy.

programme.title: And They Named Her Love
programme.desc: On her way to Los Angeles, a hopeless romantic artist meets a local singer in Atlanta and discovers that love and business don't mix well.

programme.title: 1-800 Missing
programme.desc: After his daughter goes missing, Kevin Townsend, an undercover cop, makes it his mission to save her and the missing children of Chicago.

programme.title: Dangerous Feelings
programme.desc: A happily married woman reconnects with an old flame when he is released from prison.

programme.title: The Only Child
programme.desc: A car accident that kills her mom rips apart the childhood of a 12-year-old girl who isn’t about to let his dad’s new girlfriend take her place.

programme.title: Busted and Disgusted
programme.desc: Promise is envious of Faith and her success, so she seeks to claim some of that happiness by any means necessary, no matter the cost.

programme.title: Triangle Slave
programme.desc: After rising to the top of the drug game in Philadelphia, two brothers find their empire threatened when a woman comes between them.

programme.title: Dirty Deception
programme.desc: Marcus is caught up by lust, drugs, murder and deception. When he meets Charmaine, he has to make a major change in his life and become a better man. In doing so, he finds the dirtiest deception of all may come at a cost that he can't afford.

programme.title: Cruel Ambition
programme.desc: Filmmakers Woodson and Behr seek out local investor Leon to fund their feature film but find themselves blackballed. Thinking their luck has changed when they come upon a jackpot, they find out just how cruel ambition can really be.

programme.title: Cuzzo
programme.desc: After a number of failed attempts to pass on his bloodline, a wealthy businessman makes the grave mistake of asking his cousin to impregnate his wife.

programme.title: Da Neighborhood Dopeman
programme.desc: Struggling with his finances working as a mechanic, CrimMane chooses the dope track as his side hustle, until a client offers him a dangerous proposition.

programme.title: Covered Silence
programme.desc: After years of trauma, LaLa checks in at a mental hospital and forms an unbreakable bond of friendship with Niani. Once released, LaLa takes it upon herself to protect fragile Niani at all costs, until LaLa's estranged mother returns.

programme.title: Code of Envy
programme.desc: Two lifelong friends find their close-knit relationship unraveling when a new member of their group is consumed with envy.

programme.title: Class Dismissed
programme.desc: When an unemployed actress finds herself broke and sleeping on her best friend's couch, she is forced to get a job as a substitute teacher working with one student. She soon realizes that it takes real super powers to deal with this classroom terror.

programme.title: Deceptive Intentions
programme.desc: The robbery and rape Vanessa witnessed as an impressionable young girl weave their way into her adult life with unintended and dangerous consequences.

programme.title: Deadly Housewife
programme.desc: Florence is a housewife who yearns for something new and exciting in her love life. Things turn deadly real quick when she doesn't get what she wants.

programme.title: Fall Semester
programme.desc: Kid Kypree is a college student with dreams and ambitions of becoming the next great stand-up comic. One night he gets invited to a party hosted by an old friend that throws into a whirlwind of challenges that will test his mettle and sense of humor.

programme.title: Finders Keepers
programme.desc: A struggling single father attempts a side hustle.

programme.title: Family Over Everything
programme.desc: After being set up to get jumped, West now owes the biggest Street hustler in Syracuse, Gunzo $50,000. When Gunzo's crew shows up at West's family home, his older siblings step in to protect the family from his wrath.

programme.title: The Nightcap
programme.desc: On The Nightcap we explore and question other lifestyles and cultures with an enthusiastic, open mind and hope to leave our viewers happily pondering new perspectives. The show's unique set has a full bar with a rotating cast of bartenders pouring up unique cocktails you can try to replicate at home. Whether it's inviting the most provocative guests to the signature pink couch or hearing your take on controversial topics, the conversations never disappoint. From game night to ordering in munchies, The Nightcap will keep you wanting more. It's sexy, it's risqué, it's everything you wouldn't expect from late-night TV.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: Jeff Allen: Honor Thy Wife
programme.desc: The laugh-out-loud funny stand up comedian focuses his special on the hilarious highs and relatable lows of everyday married life.

programme.title: Jeff Allen: I Can Laugh About It Now
programme.desc: The comedian discusses his life’s difficulties including addiction, bankruptcy, and how to overcome tragedy by making lemonade out of lemons.

programme.title: Leanne Morgan: So Yummy
programme.desc: The stand up comic discusses dogs, cheerleading camp, the struggles of being an empty nester, and joining Weight Watchers for the 7th time.

programme.title: Jim Gaffigan: Noble Ape
programme.desc: The stand-up comedy star describes how his wife faced a medical crisis, and he attempted to hold down the fort for their five children.

programme.title: Whitney Cummings: Money Shot
programme.desc: Comedy Central roast veteran Whitney Cummings gets the stage to herself in this debut special, which finds the young comedian riffing on a wide range of topics, chiefly the differences between men and women and how both behave in relationships.

programme.title: Jay Pharoah: Can I Be Me?
programme.desc: Saturday Night Live cast member Jay Pharoah trots out his greatest celebrity impressions, from Chris Rock to Kanye West to Barack Obama and many more.

programme.title: Lance Woods: Undeniable
programme.desc: Comedian Lance Woods brings his direct and unique takes on race relations, what he thinks about slave movies, and more on dating and modern life.

programme.title: Gary Owen: Black Famous
programme.desc: This last year has been unlike any other: COVID, lockdowns, and for Gary, it has also included a divorce and family insanity unlike any other; up until now, Gary hasn't been able to speak about what really happened.

programme.title: Gary Owen: #DoinWhatIDo
programme.desc: The so-called “Funniest Serviceman in America” draws from his multiracial experience to lambast culture wars on social media and in his own home.

programme.title: Keep Your Distance
programme.desc: Tony Baker; Sydney Castillo; D'lai; Keysha E; Ron G; Rob Haze.

programme.title: Keep Your Distance: Volume 6
programme.desc: A night of stand up comedy featuring Alycia Cooper, Kannelia Stradwick, Chaunte Wayans, and Zainab Johnson.

programme.title: Kevin Hart Presents: Lil Rel Howery - RELevent
programme.desc: Hart hosts the high-energy comic who riffs on his upbringing, raising kids, and public transportation, proving he can be hilarious and relevant.

programme.title: Plastic Cup Boyz
programme.desc: Filmed live and led by Kevin Hart, the comedy group The Plastic Cup Boyz step into the spotlight with their hilarious stand-up and sketches.

programme.title: Kevin Hart Presents: Keith Robinson - Back of the Bus Funny
programme.desc: The comic brings his in-your-face style to everything from the moment he stopped liking his son to the real reason why Obama was elected.

programme.title: Tom Papa: Freaked Out
programme.desc: Famously upbeat comedian Tom Papa delivers a stand-up performance that includes his observations on the perils of raising daughters, and more. Executive produced by Rob Zombie.

programme.title: Tom Papa: Human Mule
programme.desc: The everyman comic returns with his third hour-long stand-up special with a positive take on fighting for survival in an increasingly chaotic world.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Controlled Chaos
programme.desc: The ventriloquist comedian provides fresh, hilarious material with his favorite puppets; Walter, Peanut, and two brand new characters.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Unhinged in Hollywood
programme.desc: The comedian and his puppets perform in the gorgeous Dolby Theatre, featuring hilarious sketches with surprise guests and lots of laughs.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Spark of Insanity
programme.desc: Jeff and his felt friends Walter, Melvin the Superhero Guy, Peanut, and others share their latest and greatest thoughts about our times.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: All Over the Map
programme.desc: A comedy set and travelogue by comedian Jeff Dunham as he and his ventriloquist’s dummies perform globally from Iceland and London to Israel.

programme.title: Gary Owen: Breakin' Out the Park
programme.desc: In this brutally honest stand-up performance, comedian Gary Owen confesses his hilarious history of growing up in and around trailer parks.

programme.desc: Kevin flirts with a 'cougar', who surprisingly returns his attention.

programme.desc: After suffering the loss of his best friend Charlie on Christmas Eve, sixteen year old Bobby Whiteside ventures out onto the lake where they played countless games of winter hockey. Upon shoveling the ice surface he makes a shocking discovery --- a magic, perfectly groomed hockey rink that appears only at night and only in his presence. When a local construction company purchases the land for development, Bobby must join forces with his high school crush, rally the town, and play one last game on the night pond --- with an old friend.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to Falmouth in Cornwall, where Gaye Woods, owner of Meudon Hotel, hopes her family run hotel will win the day, but are her room rates too high?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Malborough in Devon and The Royal Oak pub, run by Tim Heap with help from his barman Mikey Martindale. Following some unwanted extras at breakfast, feedback is tough.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is in Tiverton in Devon and The Angel Guest House where owners Chris and Sue Holliday have created a homespun experience, but will they prove too competitive for the guests?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth visit is The Compton Swan in Newbury, owned by Geoff Jones and Joan McGowan. Expectations are high after Joan reveals she was named Ireland's Business Woman of the Year.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At the Brighton Surf Hotel, Jeremy Mann and his Russian wife Elena hope their hands-off hosting style will win the day, despite the lack of breakfast.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Number 16, in Greenwich, London. Owner Robert Gray, an actor and antiques dealer, charms with his hosting, but Jan and Les find the dusty decor off-putting.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At the Fleur de Lis in Sandwich in Kent, hosts Jan and Les Fisher are convinced that their traditional place will impress their guests, but Robert is bent on revenge.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit is to The Barn at Dale End House near Matlock in the Peak District, owned by Sarah Summers. Sarah is dreading Robert's arrival, but all the guests are bowled over.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Starting in Betws-y-coed, North Wales, where at Llwyn Onn Guest House, bikers Wayne and Tracy Dunn hope their no-nonsense attitude will win the competition.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Parkwood Hotel in Stockton on Tees, where newlywed managers Jon and Chelli Bean are all about making things perfect for pooches.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to Great Glen in Leicestershire and The Pug and Greyhound, where Nicola Ellershaw and her colleague, Mackenzie Griffey, hope their super-stylish accommodation will dazzle.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Solar Strand Hotel in Crosskeys, Wales, where former IT consultant Gary Pesticcio and his daughter, Naomi, hope their high-tech B&B will power them to victory.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts at The Shoes, Durham, where landlord Billy Gowland and partner Debbie Nelson hope their footwear-themed pub BandB is the right fit for their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Biggin Hall Hotel in Derbyshire, where owner James Moffat and partner Annie Larner hope the BandBers will fall for the rural charm of their 17th-century farmhouse.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit the group head to yurt glamp-site, Forest Garden Shovelstrode in East Sussex, where hosts Charles and Lisa Hooper hope the BandBers buy into their woodland retreat.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Derby Manor Hotel and Restaurant run by mother and son team Fiona and James Milligan who opened their doors eight months ago after a million pound refurbishment.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at Hope Mountain in North Wales, where husband and wife team, Rob and Jo Smith hope their dog-friendly B&B will win the day.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Beaumont Hotel in Louth, near Lincoln, where managers and best friends, Steffi Stevenson and Sarah Banks, pride themselves on being the `queens of clean'.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to Rock House Hotel in Lynmouth, Devon, where owner Emilio Tundidor is assisted by his identical twin brother Fernando.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Troy House in Painswick, where owners Alan and Denise Newman hope their guests will fall in love with their rooms.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Flying the flag on day two are Norfolk couple Jenny and Richard Harmer, from Chimneys B&B in North Walsham.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to Copperfields Guest House in Broadstairs, Kent, where owners Neale and Julie Taylor hope their exclusively vegetarian B&B will stand out from the crowd.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit this week the group head to The George and Abbotsford in Melrose, Scotland, where host Andrea Gardner and front of house manager John Marr pull out all the stops.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Massimo's in Seaham, County Durham, where Italian chef Massimo Perrulli is joined by his cousin, Raf, on front of house. Emotions run riot as things come to a head.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: This competition kicks off in Malvern, Worcestershire where retired pro-rugby player Steve Lloyd and partner Kathy Leather open their Copper Beech House to fellow B&B owners.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to the pet friendly Dog in a Doublet pub and restaurant in Peterborough where Della McGinn's passion for animals comes a close second to husband John's passion for food.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week, the B&Bers head to the Torcroft Boutique B&B in Torquay, Devon, where Europhiles Phil and Sharon Hobson hope their added extras will win over their rivals.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to the 600-year-old Rhydspence Inn in Herefordshire, owned by Mark and Lowrie Price. All guests are charmed by the medieval inn, but there's still underlying tension.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Maldon, Essex and The White Horse Inn, where hospitality expert Jayne and her husband, Pete Kocinoga, hope their attention to detail will win over their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Barnfield B&B in St Osyth, Essex, run by Christine and her toy boy husband Paul Harman. Here, as well as offering rooms, Christine also runs spiritual retreats.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit the group head to The Black Swan Inn in Pickering, Yorkshire, where Phil and Jill have spent large sums to bring their 18th century inn up to their exacting standards.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Delamere Farm in Northborough, where owner Agi Chapman, who is joined by Jayne Thorpe Godman, prides herself on providing a luxurious sleep to all her visitors.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Harrogate where management team Chris `Clarky' Clarke and Katie Light help run the White Hart Hotel. The guests meet some llamas and the extra charge for fancy coffee causes a stir.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to New Promenade Hotel in Blackpool, owned by Raouf, who is joined by friend Chrissie. There's a teetering toilet seat and Clarky and Katie find muck on the taps.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to Vicky's small terraced house, aptly named The Terrace, in Oxford. On inspection, two pairs of guests discover an array of filthy finds, including a pre-sucked sweet.

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Mesmerized by Bon Bon’s Belly Dancing, we catch up with our favourite Big Balls in the Qualifier. They dish out punishment to Australia’s very own female Jim Carrey and send Big Cat tamer Robbie into the pond. Goofy Goggles up the ante on the Dreadmill causing the Breakdancing Dad to create hilarious new moves. Golden Guns, Marisa battles it out for the ladies against Perfect Specimen, Seamus in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s Sitcom Central on Wipeout Australia with the Odd Couple, starring World’s Strongest Dwarf, David Clarke and Gentle Giant, Tim Watts. Once again the Big Balls deliver some spectacular moments with an Italian Chef being sliced and diced. Sacks are introduced at the Sweeper proving too much for some, but surprisingly helping the ladies to even things out as we go into a 50/50 male, female split in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Continuing the Top Six split up in teams for a classic MASTERCHEF challenge - to cook for food critics, writers and chefs at a pop-up restaurant in a Southern California vineyard.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: In this week's mystery box challenge, the Top 6 get a special treat as their family members join them in the MASTERCHEF kitchen.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: In the next team challenge, the junior home cooks will face an egg-cellent challenge and compete in pairs to see who can complete the most deviled eggs in 12 minutes. The team that perfects the most deviled eggs will be safe from the next elimination challenge, in which contestants must create their future cookbook’s signature dish. In the second hour, Christina Tosi brings a special guest into the MASTERCHEF kitchen, her mom, to present the next mystery box challenge, which will feature all of Christina’s favorite childhood foods. Then, contestants will compete in a tag team platter challenge using international street food ingredients.

programme.title: MasterChef

In the second hour, Christina Tosi brings a special guest into the MASTERCHEF kitchen, her mom, to present the next mystery box challenge, which will feature all of Christina’s favorite childhood foods. programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits Anna Vincenzo's, a family-run eatery in Boca Raton, Florida. He learns that the stubborn owner doesn't welcome change. After his ideas are ignored, Ramsay walks out.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares - Censored
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits Fleming, a Danish eatery in Miami. The stubborn owner doesn't want to update the place and Ramsay discovers something in the cooler that leads him to close the restaurant.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The final two chefs must prepare two appetizers and three entrées to present to a panel of respected judges. The winner gets first pick in a team of chefs eliminated from the competition.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: In the season finale, the two chefs and their respective teams participate in a final dinner service that will determine this season's winner.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Continuing the Top Six split up in teams for a classic MASTERCHEF challenge - to cook for food critics, writers and chefs at a pop-up restaurant in a Southern California vineyard.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: In this week's mystery box challenge, the Top 6 get a special treat as their family members join them in the MASTERCHEF kitchen.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The remaining six junior home cooks receive a special invitation to Gordon’s home for their next team challenge. Each team will prepare a two-course menu for a VIP lunch, including a seared red snapper appetizer and a roasted venison loin entrée. Later in the MASTERCHEF kitchen, the judges will reveal which team received the best overall feedback on their dishes and had the most successful lunch service and which contestants will be in jeopardy of elimination. Then, it’s up to the judges to decide who will go home and who will continue in the competition and compete in the semi-finals.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The remaining four junior home cooks compete in the semi-finals and are challenged to make the ultimate dessert – a soufflé! The winner receives a huge advantage in the elimination challenge. Later in the MASTERCHEF kitchen, the contestants must prepare a unique dish with a select cut of pork. Then, it’s up to the judges to decide who will go home and who will continue in the competition and compete in the finals.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares - Censored
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay finds a failing second location of a family-owned eatery. Debt, a breakdown of the family dynamic and a relative who has lost his passion for cooking all plague the restaurant.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits Spanish Pavillion in New Jersey. He discovers that a pair of bickering brothers are running the eatery to the ground with their undercooked food and outdated atmosphere.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: In the season twelve premiere, Chef Ramsay splits the twenty competing chefs into two teams. For the first challenge, each team prepares a signature dish.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The teams compete in a tricycle relay race in which the chefs work in pairs to complete basic culinary tasks. The winners go on a dinner date with Chef Ramsay in San Francisco.

programme.desc: After countless challenges, it all comes down to this. The final three home cooks will each prepare a three-course meal with ingredients of their choosing.

programme.desc: Sixteen of the country’s finest junior home cooks compete for eight of the Top 20 spots on this season’s MASTERCHEF. After being split into four groups, each with a distinct signature dish, the kids get started. Only two contestants from each group will find out if they will succeed in moving on to the next round of challenges.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay arrives at debt-ridden eatery owned by two former waitresses and things are so bad that Ramsay holds an intervention to address leadership and communication problems.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay returns to a few of the restaurants to see if they took his advice. The eateries he visits include Mojito, The Junction (formerly Flamango's) and Bazzini.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: After digging up 100 pounds of potatoes, the teams aim to delight Chef Ramsay with potato-based dishes.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The remaining contestants pair up to make ravioli dishes. The winners spend a day at a Beverly Hills mansion while the losers prep kitchens and wrap pennies.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: A group of 43 talented home cooks participate in the battle of the apron challenge, where they will compete for a position in the top 24.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The judges each will have eight aprons to hand out to the home cooks whom they deem worthy.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: In the highly anticipated Season Finale, the two finalists will compete head-to-head and prepare the most important menu of their lives. Find out which talented junior home cook will earn the MASTERCHEF trophy and a $100,000 prize.
